displayName.text: Teachers' Retirement System of the City of New York

formattedAddress: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA
adrFormatAddress: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA

originalText.text: My mom passed away 2 months ago.  I called and received a call back promptly.  I wasn’t even sure if I had benefits available. Unfortunately that was where the positivity stopped! I spoke to someone on a line that was difficult to hear so I mistakenly thought the person I spoke to was female,  I guess this caused the gentleman to be insulted because he was extremely rude!  He kept cutting me off . He was also very sarcastic and spoke to me like I had no sense.   When he finally told me what documentation was required, I sent it in.  I had to call again because I found out it was applied to my account which has been inactive for 17 years instead of my mother’s account!!!!Then I receive a call from the same person who claimed he was returning a call I did not make, who proceeded to tell me that I needed more documentation (he forget the first time?) this person has no business working with people. Especially those who have just lost a loved one.  If TRS has any accountability they will respond to this so that I can tell them who I have been speaking to.  I’m not going to put the name on here because I do actually have some sensitivity.

originalText.text: I applied for a hardship loan that I was approved on in August. The disbursement date was 9/30. I looked online a week later and it was changed to 10/30. Then two weeks following, it was changed to 11/30. My son may end up not being able to stay in school because they can't get it together and I'm beyond stressed. This place deserves no stars.

originalText.text: The customer service is not exemplar  in addition the rate funds are available are antiquated. I do appreciate the call back feature.

text.text: The customer service is not exemplar  in addition the rate funds are available are antiquated. I do appreciate the call back feature.

originalText.text: If I can give less than 1 star I would. These people are the absolute worst. I've been waiting for 7 months to receive Pension benefits. Claim just says being processed and has been saying that for months now. Then each time I ask when will the claim actually be processed they say they don't know. Absolutely insane.

originalText.text: The absolute worst! I'm a transfer contributor with 33 years of credited service. I finally had to go into the main office I retired 11/22 and my FAS is completely wrong!!! I've  called, faxed and mailed in paperwork that apparently no-one ever seems to get. Finally drove 2 hours to hand deliver paperwork proving my FAS. This is absolutely insane!!!! Whats next????
